reviews.review_msg: All this class teaches you is how to write a basic 5 paragraph essay and it feels just like high school again. This class being so repetitive, it felt like a never-ending 13-week nightmare. Jorge is a caring professor and gives lots of time for exams which are done at home. There is also a TA to correct your work so you get it back promptly.

Jorge's class was a repetitive wreck. We did the same thing every week for the whole semester. We were also forced to do weekly at home group papers for participation that were the same thing each week. Jorge also has a tendency to talk down to students.
Literally didn't go to lectures after the first day because its SO boring. 3 hrs of nothing related to the exams.

Easy class (reading, participation, essays) made difficult by the boredom incurred. So unengaged I actually lost French. Felt as though I was uselessly pushed to relearn how to write an essay, but with a rigorous structure one could not divert from. Good luck finding obscure themes in a limited time for essay exams if you're autistic.

He is the nicest prof, very engaged in the material. He takes a bit long to grade assignments, but the criteria is very clear and it's not hard to get a good grade. He gives out extensions easily too.

Jorge really gives a clear outline of what he expects of students on their assignments. If you follow his formula you are guaranteed to get a decent mark. This class is not a lot of work given that it is a 4 credit class and overall was pretty manageable compared to my other classes. I wouldn't say I learned a lot but I would take it again!

Really holds your hand through the writing process which I appreciated. I was a science major so I needed a writing workshop like this. The books he picked were really interesting. Even if you don't agree with him politically just write as if you do and you'll get a good grade. Embrace the wokeness and you'll do great.

The MOST frustrating class I've ever had to take. You're graded on 3 assignments only: 25%, 25%, 50%. I have ABSOLUTELY no clue where I'm getting my mark. His corrections are weeks late, only gives you a few comments, then bam 50%. Why I am getting this mark? Dunno. He may as well have randomly generated a # for my grade. DO NOT TAKE WITH HIM!!!!

One of the most frustrating classes I have ever taken!Graded on 3 things, an in-class dissertation, a group presentation and a final paper worth 50%! He knows a lot about Quebec litterature but doesn't seem interested in helping his students at all, takes 7+ weeks to grade anything, is unclear with his instructions and gives little to no feedback !

Im not really sure why there are so many negative reviews of Jorge but honestly he is one of the best French profs Ive had at SFU. He really makes you think about real life issues and teaches you how to think critically. Hes extremely knowledgeable and passionate about what he does. I am definitely going to take more classes with him.

I didn't really learn anything from this class aside from how to regurgitate the information he gave us (which was really repetitive and not valuable IMO). It seems like a lot of his courses are about the same thing (constructivism, social constructs, etc). If you've taken his class before you've taken them all. Not sure if it's a good or bad thing

Reasons not to take a class with Jorge: 1) Very disorganized 2) DOES NOT RESPOND TO E-MAILS, ever 3) Does not provide any feedback whatsoever on assignments 4) Does not correct assignments in a timely manner 5) Is not passionate and seems like he would rather be anywhere else in the world than in the classroom teaching literature

Very uninformed about feminism/women's issues, of which he talked about to a class of ALL WOMEN in a very condescending/patronizing manner, on topics with which he has literally no personal experience. Took the conversation away from the people it directly affected (women) & would make the girls who added to the convo feel dumb for even speaking.

I did not enjoy my time in Jorges class. It is true he is knowledgeable in regards to the literature he lectures on. However, he is not very personable, does not hand assignments back in a timely manner, and gives almost no feedback on assignments. In addition, his marking is all over the place. I definitely would not take again.

Doesn't hand back your work, doesn't apologise when he says he'll do something, and then doesn't do it, makes one assignment worth over 50% of your mark, doesn't clearly answer questions related to assignments, takes upwards of 9 weeks to mark one assignment.

I took most of my upper division courses with Jorge and he was my favourite prof in the French department. First off, he's very intelligent, opinionated and encourages debate. People get thrown off because they might find him intimidating, but talk to him and you'll find out he's the nicest guy. He changed my perspective on life in many ways. A+

It took Jorge 2 months to mark an assignment, he makes excuses without coming up with solutions, and he doesn't respond to emails. Lectures are him talking AT you for three hours and there is little analysis of the books - you would expect more from a 4th year literature class

Had a very narrow focus, which caused him to barely cover anything in 3 hours. Very slow marker- did not return anything until the second-last week of the course. Pay attention to your final grade and keep everything he hands back; a lot of people were not given the grades they earned (no +/-). He will (reluctantly) change it, but it is a hassle.

Pros: Very knowledgeable about Quebec culture, history, and literature. Cons: Follows text very closely and tests on small details (he says he'll test on general themes - don't believe him, he tests on specifics). 1000 word paper worth 50%. Takes ages to grade assignments. Other: Attendance and detailed note-taking are necessary.

This course was awful. We discussed random topics about sexuality and watched movies about sex. He asked awkward questions that I didn't feel comfortable answering in font of a class full of strangers. Never taking a course with him again.

With less than two weeks left in the semester we had yet to get any marks back. No idea how we are doing in the class. No clear marking criteria. Given only 2 weeks for our final research paper that is worth 50% of our grade. We were required to buy 5 books for the class and barely used them. Incredibly frustrating class I regret taking.

Didn't explain his expectations for any of the work, none of the assignments had to do with the books we read, and he was very unapproachable. It was a terrible experience and I wouldn't take a class with him again. People who hadn't had him before were totally in the dark as to what was going on and he didn't seem to care. :(
Pretty straight forward... found it to be quite easy.  I think it's true ... he doesnt give out As!!!

I am a straight A student and could barely even get a B- in this course. He does not listen to student comments. He also makes you feel stupid when you ask questions. I was excited to take this course, but after it started it was my worst nightmare. After studying every night, it still was not enough!
He knows his stuff but acts like he would rather be anywhere in the world. Always last to arrive to class (late) and first to leave class at the end.

I would like to begin by saying that I love french literature. However I get the impression that Jorge is doing his very best to make all of this students hate it. He is very condescending and disrespectful to his students. He will use your questions to point out his own intelligence and insult you with impunity. Do NOT take a course with him.

Worst teacher I've had in the french department. His tests are extremely unfair, expected us to know 100+ pages from the textbook (by heart) for the test. Obviously is smart with french lit. but not suitable for teaching this class. Gave us 2 days notice of what is on the test. Thanks for making me hate literature!

I think Professor Calderon is intelligent and has interesting ideas. I've taken 3 courses with him and he is one of my favourite literature profs. I think he got irked by my lousy French grammar skills so I suggest getting your papers proofread for an optimal mark

Chooses interesting topics but doesn't elaborate on them very much. You have to do your own research if you want to know more about the story. Also, you have to follow his format for the papers very closely... it seems that he cares more about the format than the content. He also cancells a lot of classes.

Jorge is clearly passionate and very knowledgeable about French Literature.  He speaks clearly, and he is usually good humoured.  He has high expectations for papers, however, and is somewhat of a hard marker.  Two papers make 90% of your mark, so it is necessary to work very hard on them, and follow his format very closely - or else!!
Very stuffy, sticks to his opinion of the texts and his opinion only.
Brings very interesting topics to class. Sometimes hesitant to open these topics up for discussion though.
